core

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.GameBoard

  • public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    Controls the moves on the Game Board and holds the actual state of the board.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      GameBoard()
      Player vs.
      GameBoard(java.lang.String compGame)
      Player vs.

      Checks over the Game Board diagonally from top to bottom to determine if the given player has four concurrent pieces.

      Checks over the Game Board horizontally to determine if the given player has four pieces in a row.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard()
        Player vs. player constructor. Invokes a new Game Board. Creates a 2D array of characters as the board, sets the win state and the draw state to false, and starts the game with 42 total pieces as there are 42 spaces to be filled.

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard(java.lang.String compGame)
        Player vs. computer constructor. Invokes a new Game Board. Creates a 2D array of characters as the board, sets the win state and the draw state to false, starts the game with 42 total pieces, and invokes a new Computer Player object passing the board state to the object.
        Parameters:
        compGame - Indicator to determine if the game type is a player vs. computer game

    • Method Detail

      • getBoardState

        public char[][] getBoardState()
        Returns the 2D array of characters that is the game board. Currently not in use.
        Returns:
        The character 2D array representation of the Game Board.

      • setBoardState

        public boolean setBoardState(int columnSelection,
                             boolean isPlayerXTurn)
        Adds new pieces to the board based on the selection of the Player. Checks if the column selection is already full and will return false to tell the Connect4TextConsole to output an error message and request a new input. If the input is valid, the piece is added and a check is made if the move created a valid win state or draw state.
        Parameters:
        columnSelection - The inputted selection by the Player.
        isPlayerXTurn - The indicator for if it's Player X's turn or not.
        Returns:
        The boolean representation of if the move made was valid.

      • printCurrentBoard

        public void printCurrentBoard()
        Prints the visual representation of the Game Board into the console.

      • getCompPlayer

        public Connect4ComputerPlayer getCompPlayer()
        Returns the computer player object.
        Returns:
        The computer player object for a player vs. computer game.

      • getWinState

        public boolean getWinState()
        Returns the boolean representation of in the Game Board is in a valid win state.
        Returns:
        The boolean representation of a valid win state.

      • setWinState

        public void setWinState(char playerTurn)
        The method checks for a win state horizontally, vertically, and diagonally. If one of the four checks is true, then the win state will change to true.
        Parameters:
        playerTurn - The character 'X' or 'O' to represent who's turn it is.

      • getDrawState

        public boolean getDrawState()
        Returns the boolean representation of if a valid draw state has been met.
        Returns:
        The boolean representation of a valid draw state.

      • setDrawState

        public void setDrawState()
        Changes the draw state to true if there are no pieces left to be placed.

      • subtractOnePiece

        public void subtractOnePiece()
        Decrements the piece count down by 1 when called.

      • checkHorizontal

        public boolean checkHorizontal(char playerTurn)
        Checks over the Game Board horizontally to determine if the given player has four pieces in a row. Returns true if four pieces in a row are found. Otherwise, returns false.
        Parameters:
        playerTurn - The char representation of the player whose turn it is.
        Returns:
        The boolean representation of if a win state was found.

      • checkVertical

        public boolean checkVertical(char playerTurn)
        Checks over the Game Board vertically to determine if the given player has four concurrent pieces in a column. Returns true if four concurrent pieces are found. Otherwise, returns false.
        Parameters:
        playerTurn - The char representation of the player whose turn it is.
        Returns:
        The boolean representation of if a win state was found.

      • checkDiagonalBotTop

        public boolean checkDiagonalBotTop(char playerTurn)
        Checks over the Game Board diagonally from bottom to top to determine if the given player has four concurrent pieces. Returns true if four concurrent pieces are found. Otherwise, returns false.
        Parameters:
        playerTurn - The char representation of the player whose turn it is.
        Returns:
        The boolean representation of if a win state was found.

      • checkDiagonalTopBot

        public boolean checkDiagonalTopBot(char playerTurn)
        Checks over the Game Board diagonally from top to bottom to determine if the given player has four concurrent pieces. Returns true if four concurrent pieces are found. Otherwise, returns false.
        Parameters:
        playerTurn - The char representation of the player whose turn it is.
        Returns:
        The boolean representation of if a win state was found.
